metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2143 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The fork implementation in the Linux kernel before 4.5 on s390 platformsmishandles the case of four page-table levels, which allows local users tocause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted application, related toarch/s390/include/asm/mmu_context.h and arch/s390/include/asm/pgalloc.h.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
